DOC.HEAD: BBC Listeners Name Gorbachev Man of the Year
DOC.TEXT: British Broadcasting Corp. listeners have chosen Soviet President Mikhail S. Gorbachev as Man of the Year. Listeners who voted gave Gorbachev three times as many votes as runner-up Sir Anthony Meyer, the British lawmaker who challenged Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher for the Conservative Party leadership. It was the second year Gorbachev has won the contest sponsored by BBC Radio Four's ``Today'' public affairs program. Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, placed third in this year's poll, down from second last year, the BBC said Saturday. The BBC does not disclose the number of votes cast for each candidate. But it said Friday, when announcing Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher had been selected Woman of the Year, that she also polled three votes in the Man of the Year contest.
